intro: Antiphylla parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered antiphylla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, pale yellow to white flowers are arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Antiphylla parviflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
